entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hwanne, hwenne; akin to Old High German hwanne when, Old English hwā who who

def.dt: :at what time when will you return
:at a former and usually less prosperous time brag fondly of having known him when Vance Packard

entry.et: Middle English, from Old English hwanne, hwenne, from hwanne, hwenne, adverb

def.dt: :at or during the time that :while went fishing when he was a boy
:just at the moment that stop writing when the bell rings
:at any or every time that when he listens to music, he falls asleep
:in the event that :if a contestant is disqualified when he disobeys the rules
:considering that why use water at all when you can drown in it Stuart Chase
:in spite of the fact that :although quit politics when I might have had a great career in it
:the time or occasion at or in which tomorrow is when we must decide humor is when you laugh Earl Rovit
:what or which time life-long homes for those … who have lived here since when Kim Waller
:the time in which something is done or comes about troubled his head very little about the hows and whens of life Laurence Sterne
